Baltimore critics including Donald Kirkley, of the "Morning Sun;"
George Browning, of the "Home
News," and Norman Clark, of the
"News-Post" joined in lauding tomorrow's show.

audience. How about it?

Degree For Malone
Dr, Kemp Malone, professor of English at the ohns Hopkins University,
will receive the honorary degree of
doctor of letters from Emory University, Atlanta, at the university's centennial convocation on December 12,
Harvey W. Cox, president, announced
last week.
Dr. Malone, who graduated from the
Atlanta University in 1907, was nominated for the degree jointly by the
University Council of Deans and 1'ret8ident Cox. The nomination was confirmed by a vote of the board of trustees.

were never able to get the ball inside
the Blue Jay 40-yard stripe.
The game was extremely tough and
hard fought. Three University of Maryland players were injured due to the
hard blocking and playing of both
teams.

played an excellent game for the Jay

plaoes Hopkins at the top of Maryland's collegiate touch-football teams.

Degree For Malone
Dr, Kemp Malone, professor of English at the ohns Hopkins University,
will receive the honorary degree of
doctor of letters from Emory University, Atlanta, at the university's centennial convocation on December 12,
Harvey W. Cox, president, announced
last week.
Dr. Malone, who graduated from the
Atlanta University in 1907, was nominated for the degree jointly by the
University Council of Deans and 1'ret8ident Cox. The nomination was confirmed by a vote of the board of trustees.

Ditrnar, captain of the Terp team,
played an excellent game for the Jay
opponents. He led a varied attack, using many tricky reverses and fast
plays, but the Black and Blue defense
coped with all Maryland could offer.
Maryland had beaten the touchfootball champs of Catholic University, Western Maryland and St. Johns.
The victory over the Terps therefore
plaoes Hopkins at the top of Maryland's collegiate touch-football teams.
